column2: “2 Years Ago” – Reddit // assuming as of June 2021 this means July 2018

column33: Notes
From a PDF on the natureworks website 3DOMFuel PLA filaments use the following, Standard:4043D, Workday:3D850, Pro PLA:3D870.
unknown where the filament is made or material source, not stated on site or amazon ads that I can find. Im not sure where the info that this is made in the US came from.
lots of corporate speak but no material sourcing information on site or ads.
"using only American-made supplies where possible. "
incomplete and minimal website, little info. No info on material source, only generic claim of 'made in usa')
no source 'Manufactured in U.S.A'
company and manufacturing in the u.s. but no source given for the materials
full source info not stated "only use premium US-made raw materials", but they also sell NatureWork pellets so thats likely source
Source not given, only "We source top-quality raw materials"
Lots of words but no specific sourcing, "made in-house using 100% domestically sourced and produced materials" Site is 100% sold out of everything but HTPLA so no pricing available

Extensive site, but they dont actually state the source of the materials. Some but not all filament is made in the u.s. "Is this filament made in the United States of America? It is not, however, all of our PRO Series is manufactured in the US"
no source information for materials given

no source for materials given, corporate non retail site, extensive site but I cant find any claim to being u.s. made, and headquartered in Canada so possibly made in Canada. Not available for sale on company site - prices found elsewhere
no source given for materials
Subsidiary of a U.S. company but doesn't actually state on their website that its made in the u.s. or source materials. They only offer flexibles PLA/PETG/ABS n/a
website filled with technical data aimed at industry, difficult to find retail area. Retail area 1/2 broken and using shopping cart defaults. 1 product available, no material source given.
no source for materials given

no material source information given. Their blog has an entry about installing a filament extrusion operation in house in 2019. They mention their pellets are “sourced” from Nebraska, spools are “manufactured” in Indiana, and colors are “manufactured” in Illinois. Quotes added to point out the lines and margins. You choose what is line and margin.
no sources for materials given They only offer 'advanced' filmaments with fiber and the like.
lists PMMA aka Acrylic 1kg=$49 and PEI@$70 for .5kg
no source given for materials, resellers of 'Atomic' brand filament (see above)

U.S. company but no claim that their products are made in the u.s. Some claims that they work with Dupont, and Dow Chemical. Unknown sources. Only has Nylons and advanced. materials. PLA/PETG/ABS N/a. No physical address listed on the website.
no source given for materials. Website has broken links and shopping area has labels copy pasted into the wrong areas (like listing PLA in the ABS description area)

no source for materials given on folgertech site. U.S. Monofilment is made by EMCO and on their site source is listed as Nature Works 3D850. On folgertech site PLA $20, PETG n/a, ABS n/a EMCO site PLA $15 (on sale), PETG/ABS n/a //2021: no merch on website, states ‘we sell on ebay’ in the “about-us” page.
